chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)
Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.execSummary:
The defendant John Louis Klepper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).
  • Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Same conditions for both counts. Submit DNA sample. No possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages. Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Louis Klepper

records.addlTxt: of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief  filed by Atty Schonscheck
Filed by Attorney Schonscheck

9:46 AM Prosecuting attorney Brenda L. Yaskal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant John Louis Klepper in court.  Attorney Armand Patrick Schonscheck in court for John Louis Klepper. Amended complaint filed. Waived reading. Advisement of rights. Agreement recited by State. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to both counts of amended complaint. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Sentencing statements. Court withheld sentencing, placed the defendant on probation for 2 years each count. Conditions of probation include: Submit DNA sample. No possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages. Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Costs of $443.00 for count 1 and $243.00 for count 2. 3 days credit. 10:04 AM
